info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:41PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern New Castle and southwestern Chester Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 441 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Oxford, or 12 miles northwest of Newark, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newark, Kennett Square, Oxford, West Grove, North Star, Landenberg, Mount Vernon, Pike Creek, Kemblesville, Hockessin, Homeville, Glasgow, Bear, Avondale, Toughkenamon and Brookside. This includes Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 0 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northern Delaware...and southeastern Pennsylvania.
